column1: Palwal  is a city and a municipal council. It is the headquarters of Palwal district
column2: the 21st district of Haryana state in northern India. It is a centre for the cotton trade in the area.

column1: Palwal is 60 kilometres (37 mi) from Delhi
column3: 314 kilometres (195 mi) from Chandigarh and 143 kilometres (89 mi) from Agra.The latitude of the town is 28° 40' N and longitude is 76° 59' E. The area of town is 22.10 square kilometres (8.53 sq mi).The local tradition identifies Palwal with the Apelava town mentioned in the Mahabharata
column4: which was later restored by Vikramaditya.

column1: The origin of Palwal is related to the local legend related to the Mahabharata
column2: according to which the town is named after an asura called "Palwasura" who was slain by Balarama
column3: the brother of Krishna. To commemorate this even an annual festival called "Baldev Chhat Ka Mela" is held here
column4: and a "Dauji temple" in honor of Balrama is situated in Banchari village 25 km from Palwal on Grand Trunk Road.

column1: Palwal is located at 28.12°N 77.33°E﻿ / 28.12; 77.33. It has an average elevation of 195 metres (640 ft).
A historical building Gandhi Seva Ashram( Museum) was made in the memory of Mahatma Gandhi.

The Gandhi Museum is close to Palwal Railway Station. Mahatma Gandhi was arrested on 10 April 1919 at Palwal railway station while going to Punjab against the Rowlatt Act. Keeping this memory alive lasting on October 2
